Due to the orders I received from Your Excellency Captain Rafael José Viana on the 21st with 50 men from the 5th Corps and Ensign Prestes from the 3rd Corps, with 30 men, to gather the cavalry from the vicinity of the hill of Roque and Erval, to maintain the force under my command that was on foot, which the said Captain and Ensign Prestes gathered over three hundred; and I marching with over a hundred men from the body of my command and 50 men from the 3rd Brigade commanded by Captain Antônio Fernando, which totaled 230, and making junction at the hill of Roque, I sent Major Mariano Martins with over a hundred men to cross the São João mountain, running towards the coast of Velhaco and Camaquã. And I marched with the rest of the force directly to the parish of Encruzilhada, which I entered on May 26, without encountering any resistance; finding the parish deserted due to the terrified inhabitants fleeing from the frightening news spread by the farrapos who roamed from hill to hill, I made the opposite known to the inhabitants, giving them the proclamations from Your Excellency Captain Boaventura with 40 men beyond Encruzilhada, and descending along the bank of Camaquã, who joined me in São José with 200 horses; I crossed to the other side of Camaquã and sent Lieutenant Isaías to the chapel of Boqueirão with a detachment, and there he gathered the horses he could and descended to the Braga estate, where today José Gomes Jardim, the Vice-President of the Republic, winters, to join me, and repassing Camaquã Major Mariano who had gathered 300 tame horses and over 200 colts and 40 tame and wild mules. Marching to São José, I sent Captain Antônio Fernando with the troops from the 2nd and 3rd Brigades taking 400 of the best horses and 80 colts as requested by the Illustrious Colonel Loureiro, who was heading for the campaign and was lacking horses; and I returned to this place on the 9th of the current month, with 800 tame horses, 200 colts, and 40 tame and wild mules, having found no gathering except small groups in the woods, of which 3 were killed, and saddles and arms were taken.

The woods are full of men deserted from the enemy ranks, saying that only the head will gather; the major influencers are very discouraged, and they say that since the moment they learned that the farrapos were entrenched inside Taquari, they deemed the Republic lost, and many are already asking for amnesty from the Government; I, Your Excellency
